result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher M Hawley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher M Hawley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher M Hawley was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: May petition for early discharge if Probation finds appropriate.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to Probation while on Probation.  Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to Probation while on Probation.  Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  
May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.
If not a U.S. Citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
Eligible for expungment upon successful completion of Probation.
Must complete an AODA assessment & comply with recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
30 days to be served up front.  Must report by 1/6/2017, at 6:30 p.m.  May serve in another county as long as there is no cost to Polk County.
Subject to Work Release.  NOT subject to Good Time.
60 days banked/stayed for use by Probation if necessary.
